verses.name: Job 22:1
verses.text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,

verses.name: Job 22:2
verses.text: Can a man be profitable unto God, as he that is wise may be profitable unto himself?

verses.name: Job 22:3
verses.text: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? or is it gain to him, that thou makest thy ways perfect?

verses.name: Job 22:4
verses.text: Will he reprove thee for fear of thee? will he enter with thee into judgment?

verses.name: Job 22:5
verses.text: Is not thy wickedness great? and thine iniquities infinite?

verses.name: Job 22:6
verses.text: For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for nought, and stripped the naked of their clothing.

verses.name: Job 22:7
verses.text: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.

verses.name: Job 22:8
verses.text: But as for the mighty man, he had the earth; and the honourable man dwelt in it.

verses.name: Job 22:9
verses.text: Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.

verses.name: Job 22:10
verses.text: Therefore snares are round about thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee;

verses.name: Job 22:11
verses.text: Or darkness, that thou canst not see; and abundance of waters cover thee.

verses.name: Job 22:12
verses.text: Is not God in the height of heaven? and behold the height of the stars, how high they are!

verses.name: Job 22:13
verses.text: And thou sayest, How doth God know? can he judge through the dark cloud?

verses.name: Job 22:14
verses.text: Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven.

verses.name: Job 22:15
verses.text: Hast thou marked the old way which wicked men have trodden?

verses.name: Job 22:16
verses.text: Which were cut down out of time, whose foundation was overflown with a flood:

verses.name: Job 22:17
verses.text: Which said unto God, Depart from us: and what can the Almighty do for them?

verses.name: Job 22:18
verses.text: Yet he filled their houses with good things: but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

verses.name: Job 22:19
verses.text: The righteous see it, and are glad: and the innocent laugh them to scorn.

verses.name: Job 22:20
verses.text: Whereas our substance is not cut down, but the remnant of them the fire consumeth.

verses.name: Job 22:21
verses.text: Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.

verses.name: Job 22:22
verses.text: Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thine heart.

verses.name: Job 22:23
verses.text: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.

verses.name: Job 22:24
verses.text: Then shalt thou lay up gold as dust, and the gold of Ophir as the stones of the brooks.

verses.name: Job 22:25
verses.text: Yea, the Almighty shall be thy defence, and thou shalt have plenty of silver.

verses.name: Job 22:26
verses.text: For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.

verses.name: Job 22:27
verses.text: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows.

verses.name: Job 22:28
verses.text: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee: and the light shall shine upon thy ways.

verses.name: Job 22:29
verses.text: When men are cast down, then thou shalt say, There is lifting up; and he shall save the humble person.

verses.name: Job 22:30
verses.text: He shall deliver the island of the innocent: and it is delivered by the pureness of thine hands.
